Articles.Content:
Seeing as i am Trussian comrade, and saw no IL-2 replicas, i decided to make an IL-2 Replica, comrade!

![Q5166zk.png](http://i.imgur.com/Q5166zk.png)

It flies well, because of two additional static elevons that point down in the back Soviet engineering, comrade!

Features somewhat realistic design, and a historically accurate speed because is slower than jets, comrade!

![FSPyRcH.png](http://i.imgur.com/FSPyRcH.png)

Even features closed rear end made somehow good enough to allow movement, comrade!

![ay1w7KZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/ay1w7KZ.png)

Be a part of Soviet Air Force now, comrade!

[https://www./?63xfk0hgw5rdyzd](https://www./?63xfk0hgw5rdyzd)
Good, comrade! But where would comrade's propulsion be? (Translate: where is the engine?)

Everyone's doing the double Mk1 inlines now it seems ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Nice craft!

> 
> Everyone's doing the double Mk1 inlines now it seems ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> Nice craft!

Blame SQUAD for adding the bit behind the canopy, comrade! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Well, the Mk1 inlines needed to be doubled in .90, too. But hipster!
